intro: Pterisanthes brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and upright, herbaceous stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
